Great place! Liked the food and the environment! The staff was awesome, really nice!! Can definitely recommend this place!

The food 4 years ago I remember being better than this time.  I keep asking myself why do I get sushi in the middle of the desert??  The rolls are very mediocre.  Good cucumber drink and the molten lava dessert is yummy!  We found a seat at the sushi bar in the back by chance around 8:30 and ended up getting a stamp to get into the club later so we didn't have to wait in line.

As Yelp's two star tagline would suggest, "Meh. I've experienced better."

We were a party of seven as a walk-in, but they couldn't find us a table for an hour. Fortunately, there was a waiting area with couches that we could order non-main course menu items from.

Unfortunately, it was near impossible to find a server, and there was no one checking on us either. We literally needed to flag down people as they were hauling empty dishes back or carrying drinks out to ask questions or put in an order.

We ended up getting the drunken lobster pad thai, chicken pad thai, and some rolls.

And, really, it was all just meh.

A table opened up, but we had ordered enough at that point and just left.

It's amazing how many people will flock to, and convince themselves they enjoyed, an establishment built largely on hype and trashy Hollywood party skanks. Tao broke my number one restaurant rule; they made us wait 20+ minutes for a Monday night reservation. 

Thankfully, Paris Hilton upskirts and Lohan sightings aren't enough to compel me to wait around to be seated after we had a reservation; so we left. And when we did; they could've cared less. Shocker.

If you are vegetarian or vegan the choices are very limited and not that great .good marketing so they will draw you in but you may be disappointed .
Noodles are salty vegetable fried rice you can hardly  find the rice feels like we order a salad .
Sushi rolls are very average.... 
Good service friendly stuff

We came here with a party of 7 on a Saturday night at 9pm. Yeah we had reservations, this is Vegas!

Prices....yeah....this is Vegas. As I said in my other reviews of Vegas places, you don't come here to save money so don't get mad at the price.

We ate like kings and queens here. Pretty much had the entire menu as each person ordered a different appetizer and main dish. Very fancy, delicious and FAST considering the whole place was packed and busting at the seams. The kitchen and wait staff do great here. 

Ended up paying $107 a person before tip. Totally worth it when in a big group because you try pretty much the entire menu and the price included 1 drink. I didn't need any more than 1 drink here anyway. No, not because they pour them so strong....because we pregame and I was all set, if you know what I mean. Hey, it's Vegas baby!!!

I was visiting Las Vegas for Memorial Day Weekend & came here for dinner on Saturday night to celebrate my birthday. We were a party of 12.  Everything was great.  The service was spot on & even knew random facts about Tao NY vs Tao LV since our table was debating certain things.  Food was spectacular, as always. I stuck to my usual Tao-tini.  Never fails.

Giving it a one star only because I have to. The only thing worse than the food was the service. The waiter was so, so rude. He didn't, ask questions, never came to check on drinks even when he was right there. I am a reasonable person. If it was so busy and he was working very hard, I'd understand. Since he had enough time to stand at the back and observe, I would think he could make himself useful and at least refill our drinks. This is Vegas people, many, many, many better options. Do not waste your time or money on this place. There were three of us, no one liked their meals. It is also very loud, as it is part of a night club -- I didn't mind this part -- that was actually the fun part. What I didn't appreciate was where I was seated. They seated us at the back where the staff kept going in and out from, with dishes et al -- and every time someone would pass, most likely would knock into me. The rudest part was no one -- not even one person there apologized for doing so.  

I am disappointed as after reading the reviews people have received good to decent service -- not in our case.

Yikes, save yourself the trouble and drop your dime elsewhere. Way, way better options available.

Tao the club is a 5 star! Tao the restaurant is 3 star. The menu is large and full of Asian dishes, from sushi to Pad Thai to basic Chinese. The decor and venue is amazing and the food is good not great. The prices for a sushi roll starts at $17-$29 bucks per roll. We did sushi and it was very average for the prices they charge, it did not fully impress us. I'll always be back to Tao to club but not dine.

Pleasantly surprised. Great ambiance and direct access to the club right after!

Food: the best were the pork potstickers, duck spring rolls, and tuna tartare. The chilean sea bass, which is supposed to be their most popular item on the menu, was actually pretty bad - the taste was off and we couldn't even finish it.

Fancy place for Asian cuisine and sushi. 

I really liked the sushi. The drinks are good too. They're expensive but met my expectations for a trendy restaurant in Vegas. And we got a stamp to go into the club afterwards where we had a good time. So I enjoyed my experience.

We enjoyed the overall experience here.
We ate at TAO last July ('07) and found it all a new sort of dining experience.

We had a reservation but still had to wait an hour for a table, the waiting area was overcrowded but still comfortable. The bar staff were very good in fetching drinks while you waited.

The rather 'slutty' waitresses were a little off putting.  Even my husband (who enjoys a good eyeful) said that the whoreishness of the waiting area servers was obnoxious and way over the top.

We got a table right next to the big statue and the candle wall and that was really nice. Our server (luckily not one of the whoreish ones) was really nice and spent a little time talking to us and just being hospitable.

We LOVED the food. A wide range and many different things to try. I think there is something for everyone, if they like the 'out of the ordinary' Asian food.

This (of course) being Vegas and in the Venetian is going to have that little extra price tag, but it was exorbitant and we though it was worth paying a little more for the experience of TAO.

-1/2 a star for the stupid waiting time, -1/2 a star for the hooker waitresses.

Excellent food.  Excellent service.  Edmund is the best!  
Menu is woohoo extensive that it really is difficult to pick.  Luckily it's best done family style.  We really liked seared scallops in curry sauce (rather spicy though), lobster clay bowl, and braised pork buns.  For dessert: the bread pudding and the mochi sampler.  One note, is to order sides of rice as the dishes need some form of starch.

Delicious Chinese food presented all fancy in a cool setting.  I was surprised at how good the food was.  Seven of us ladies dined here on Saturday and got the $55/ person pre fixe menu.  We were able to substitute some items.  

Edamame - Nice way to start out.

Roasted Shishito Peppers with Yuzu - I loved that garlic sauce.

Alaskan Salmon, Crab, and Avocado Roll -  Perfect little bite.

Salmon Sashimi with Avocado, Crispy Onions, Sweet and Spicy Sesame Sauce - Heavenly.  One of my favorite dishes.

Chinese Five Spice Short Ribs - So tender and packed with salty flavor.

Lobster ravioli - I loved the texture of this velvety dumpling and the mushrooms.

Crispy Coconut Shrimp with Spicy Thai Peanut Sauce - My least favorite dish.

Miso Glazed Chilean Sea Bass with Wok Vegetables - Another favorite dish.  The fish was so buttery and fatty and moist.

Mandarin Sizzled Fried Rice with Roast Pork - Really good!

Crispy Orange Chicken - I was impressed!  This was no Panda Express orange chicken!

Wasabi Crusted Filet Mignon with Tempura of Onion Rings - Wow!  Such tender meat and that crust was like tempura.  

Yuzu Sugar Dusted Doughnuts - The caramel was my favorite dipping sauce.

This was the perfect amount of food for seven of us girls.  Our server, bussers, and food runners made a really smooth dining experience.  They were on it.  My server ran over when he saw me looking around fondling my empty martini glass.

Ladies, you can get into Tao nightclub free after you dine.  Get a free drink wrist band good until 11:30 PM upstairs.  Make sure you make a reservation and put your name on the guest list 24 hours prior to partying.  They print out their lists ahead of time so you can't do it the day of.

Scrumptious! Loved Tao, we had an early reservation, 5 p.m. as we were going to see Phantom of the Opera, so I cannot verify the issues of other reviews who had to wait a long time even with a reservation.

We were promptly seated, and hats off to Titus our server. He was fabulous. When asking for recommendations he was honest and truthful offering an explanation as to why he felt the way he did about a dish. He was attentive, friendly and fun to interact with during our dining experience.

Now to the food, we started with the Lobster Wontons, steamed and not fried and exquisite. The lobster was perfectly cooked, and the ginger broth was amazing, 5 wontons was a great starter, but left us wanting many more.
I ordered the Wok Seared New York strip, it was seared to  perfection with a nice crust on the outside, yet tender on the inside. The sauce is bursting with strong Asian flavors that are a perfect accompianment.
Tony ordered the Omakase, which is sushi and sashimi and is the Chef's choice. He was thrilled with everything served on the plate. 

The food was wonderful,so  we decided to break with tradition and order dessert, that turned out to be a good decision. We ordered the Chocolate Eggrolls served with an Orange dipping sauce, again, truly amazing, there is nothing better than something with a crunch and oozing warm melted chocolate. 

Can't wait to go back!

The service, the ambiance, the place! Jaime was an awesome server. She gave very good recommendations for what to order. We had amazing sushi rolls and miso soup that night. Best restaurant ever! I will definitely be coming back

Great food service and atmosphere! Went there 7 months pregnant and was able to have plenty of options for cooked sushi. We got the angry dragon roll and spicy lobster. The angry dragon was both of our favorites! 

Waitress was very kind!!! Suggest getting reservations though we had them but it looked very busy.

Possibly the best restaurant I have been to Vegas. It was worth every cent. A table of 10 we had the degustation menu and loved the chef choices. We explained a few food allergies and every dish was incredible! My fave was the short ribs (we loved them so much we ordered another plate), our guest raved about the sea bass, the vegetables were incredible. Delicious cocktails and attentive service make this a must-do in Vegas. Book as soon as you know you are going to be in that town.

Been there 10 times. Every dish is better than the one before. Amazing place. I heard TAO is the number one volume restaurant in the US for the past 4 yrs. Incredible service for such high volume!  Have the waiter bring you an assortment of dishes - I don't even look at the menu.

so i've been lucky enough that the many times i've eaten here, the meal was comped...otherwise, i don't think i would eat here voluntarily after the first visit...for asian fusion, i've definitely had much better!

the ambience is great...mood lighting, great decor...overall, good vibe...even after being around for vegas for some time, tao is still considered a "hot spot"...after dinner you can make your way upstairs for drinks and dancing and maybe even possibly rub elbows with some celebrities

anyway, back to the food...each time, we had 3 course meals that included everything but the kitchen sink...honestly i can say that i've probably tried the entire menu. and i realized that what makes everything taste "good" is that everything is smothered in some extremely salty sauce or another...otherwise it has nothing to do with how well each dish is prepared. they just slop some meat and noodles and this and that into a pan or a pot and saute it in a can of salty sauce number 1 - 10. throw in some veggies and voila, you have a signature tao dish. again if i had to pay for it, i wouldn't eat here...thank goodness for comped meals! but i will have to say try the chilean sea bass...again quite salty, but mmm, this is the one thing i would get again and again...

for dessert, i've tried a platter of everything offered on the dessert menu...from the lava cake to the giant fortune cookie to the mochi balls, i've tried it all...the gigantic fortune cookie is fun to eat more than anything else (comes with naughty fortunes too), but everything else is just meh~. definitely avoid the lava cake though...tasteless and chalky...my absolutely favorite dessert was a mousse parfait of some sort served in a tall glass...at the very bottom of the parfait was this phenomenal chocolatey crunchy goodness that i could've eaten an entire bowl of

I had here beast time 
The food was amazing is this there is even better than the food I definitely will come back and recommend to friends
place is beautiful
Service was good (our server waa attentive)  the food was just OK - nothing special.  I wouldn't recommend...

weak. I would say to go here only if you want to skip the line and get into Tao nightclub.

To get in you'll need to order one of their entree dishes or two sushi rolls. I got some sushi that I can't remember. I think it was the angry dragon and a spicy shrimp roll with asparagus. Both were just okay. Some of my buddies got the black pepper filet mignon with udon noodles. How would I describe it? salty! It was like they poured in some soy sauce and decided to leave the bottle titled while they cook the food. That dish was dissapointing. Maybe we got some bad dishes, but gotta be more consistent than this!

Service was pretty good, but the food was meh. Go here if you want entry into the club. I wouldn't recommend it otherwise.

Had the XO Chinese Long Beans. I am not sure it is really the long beans or the regular green beans because they were all cut into sections. Drinks are quite pricey but the service was good. I am happy that we came in all casual compares to other guests that are dressed up, yet was treated well.
Tried two types of Dim Sum dumplings and it was such a tease for the price they are charging.

3.5 star Asian fusion food (eg. Lobster pad Thai) Come here for the service and atmosphere. I remember having to wait as we didn't make a reservation, but you can sit at the bar area and order drinks as you wait.

Tao Asian Bistro is a trendy, OVERPRICED version of PF Chang's located in the Venetian Hotel. At first glance, Tao's eastern Buddhist inspired atmosphere was inviting, warm, and unique despite the men in black that guarded the entrance. Even on a Tuesday night, the dining room was almost full with late 20s- 30s casual business class patrons. Our host and waiter were efficient though and we were seated right away. So, 4 stars for the ambience and courteous staff!!

Food: We ordered a spicy tuna avocado roll and Singaporean noodle paired with tap water, of course. The spicy tuna avocado roll was good, but nothing spectacular for its $17 price tag. The Singaporean noodle ($26! oh shit! ka-ching!) was dry, cold, and boasted of flavors from the far-east...just kidding, more like flavors from the Costco frozen aisle. Since it was my bff's birthday, they gave us a delicious complimentary dessert, which was the best part of the meal...and i would come back here just for that. The dessert was creatively presented as a giant fortune cookie, decked with a lining of chocolate almonds atop a bed of vanilla and chocolate mouse and surrounded by fresh fruits. The "fortune cookie" is really a crunchy crepe, which was not too sweet and just the right price (free!). 

We were definitely disappointed with this meal overall, but still had an awesome time because the crowd and waiters were fun! If you want to dress up, but not to the fancy extent of Picasso or Joel Robunchon (umm...completely different price range lol), you might want to check this place out. We might try this place again, but next time opt for their entrees instead.

Really great decor and indicative of a great Vegas dining experience!! This was my 6th time here, but I never left a review before. Things I've tried here are: Sushi rolls (Great), Flamingo Roll (Good), Sea Bass (Great) Wasabi encrusted Filet (Good), Tuna Tartar on crispy rice (Amazing). It's the desserts that were killer; Mochi Ice Cream (Great) and a bread Pudding that had a Carmel sauce that was off the hook - WOW! (we joked that it must have cocaine in it it was so great!). The key is to get a reservation and come early for dinner.

Outstanding food, service and ambiance. Each dish is artfully created and presented. Flavors burst in your mouth. Our server was Jeffrey. Is only directs you in the right way. We loved everything we ordered. Vibe is friendly and sophisticated--hard to pull off but they do it. Worth every bite. Prices are totally reasonable. This is a photo f their chocolate molten cake. Amazing!

I took some good friends to TAO to eat and we were very disappointed. Our server(Anthony: black guy) was terrible. To be a server in a loud establishment I would expect someone to speak clearly and concisely. He was arrogant, did not answer questions but rather dodged them. He was clearly annoyed because he seemed lost and in a rush. I busboy served us ice water in a glas with LIPSTICK on it. Gross!  We should have left after that but be soldiered  on because we already waited so long. We shared plates. The food was average but overpriced. Do not recommend this place. TerribleAwfulOverpriced that is the acronym for TAO

Was at private table for 13.  Food was good not amazing but good.  Salmon was very good.  Deserts average.  Very loud very busy. Not a place for a quiet romantic meal.  But worth a trip if you like the Asian fusion thing

VERY disappointing, especially for a Vegas restaurant that charges an arm and a leg. Just for a restaurant itself, very very disappointing. 

This was supposed to be an Asian fusion type restaurant but it really lacked in Asian authenticity in terms of flavor. It seemed like the chefs just used different types of sauces  to compensate for lack of flavor which resulted in chaos. 

Fried rice with sausage: Very SMALL portion. Weird "sweet and sour" sauce spread over the rice. I would not order again. 

Pad Thai: Lacking flavor. Some type of sweet taste that I knew after one bite, I would get sick of it after subsequent bites. Very unauthentic. I would not order this again either.

Sort of embarrassed to say that we ate here twice on our 4-day trip - once to get into Lavo nightclub free (although we thought the Tao club would be open that night) and the second time to get into Tao for free right after.

Very good, perhaps slightly overpriced, (but barely) Asian fusion food.  Gorgeous, sexy d√©cor and lighting.  I had dumplings to start both nights, and veggie pad thai the second night followed by a veggie sampler the second.  The sake braised mushrooms we had as a side dish were very rich on the second night.

A great value if you're interested in going to either club, but we weren't especially impressed with either club.  Still a decent dinner choice on the Strip.

This place was lively and the service was great. We have 11 and 12 year old boys and they thought the atmosphere was Epic and enjoyed the busyness & Music in the background. We are from a small Colorado Town and don't have anything like this. The food was Great as well. Everything had good flavor and spice. The only boring item was the Pork Potstickers. The Sushi was fresh (don't forget I'm from Colorado) & tasty. The Singapore Noodle could have had more bite but I like it hot. It was very $$$ but I think we would defiantly go back.

Very romantic place to eat, with tasty food to digest :)

The only problem, and it's well-known to be one is regardless of reservations, you're going to wait and even be given a "buzzer/pager" -- we waited over 30 minutes past our reservations, though for transparency reasons if you have a reservation in Tao (Los Angles) you're looking at ~2hrs wait time, so while they never fulfill the reservation time it's at least less than LA's wait times.

Food overall very good, no real complaints on the food, I had the seared tuna, rolls, duck, wagyu, sake. Recommended for sure!

Located on the second floor of the venetian.
Everything we had here was delicious and the ambience is stunning.  I give it 4 stars because I still think it's overpriced. Would I go back though? Definitely.

This is the second time my wife and I have been to the Tao Asian Bistro, the first time being 5 years ago. It was just as we remembered! We were greated warmly, and arriving at 5:30 on a Friday evening we were seated promptly. Our waiter took great care in making sure we understood the menu. My wife ordered the tempura eggplant and the mandarin fried rice with pork and I ordered the chilean sea bass. Both of our entrees arrived warm and presented well. I sampled my wife's fried rice and I can honestly say it was the best I have had. And the chilean sea bass was just as I remembered it...out of this world! We topped it off with the giant fortune cookie...holy smokes was it good! For the two of us it was under $100 and well worth it!

This was our first time to Tao.  My wife and I really liked it.  The food was excellent and given that it is clearly a gourmet Asian the portion sizes were just right, the presentation of the food was very artistic and well done.  The atmosphere is very cool and hip with a great vibe going on all night there....we did go to the club afterwards and while the website shows this as a big looking club we actually found it to be a bit cramped an small for the amount of people they let in....unless you get bottle service be prepared to feel like a second class citizen....the security people are somewhat militant as one time I set my drink down to simply put on my blazer and was immediately approached that I was not allowed to set my drink there....a bit ridiculous and extreme IMHO.   We will definitely go back to the restaurant but will skip the club even if it offers free admission with our dining experience as It was not enjoyable.
This is one of the best restaurants on the Strip for Asian Fusion food, great atmosphere, food, and service.

My husband and I just finished dining at Tao. We are from out of town and it was our first time eating here. Not only was the food exception the service was the best we have had on our trip. Amanda P our server took time to help us with the menu, made sure we found things we would like and even treated us to dessert as we were celebrating our 10 year wedding anniversary. It didn't stop with Amanda, every person who came to our table was very helpful and at the top of their game. It was great to learn about how everything is made on site, you could taste the freshness in the homemade lo mean noodles, the diver sea scallops were by far my favorite but my husband loved the spicy dragon roll!  Looking for an intimate setting with great food and great service Tao should be on your list!

Large parties dining at Tao should know this....
___________________________
To my surprise, 4 stars for the food, but an overall 2 stars for the ridiculous way we were charged for the food and how our complaint was handled.  I dined at Tao with a group of 9 for a bachelorette party the weekend of August 13, 2007. Although I was disappointed with Tao, I still had a great time with my fabulous girlfriends. 

I don't remember everything we had, but I enjoyed the Spare Ribs, Lobster Wontons, Chilean Sea Bass. Least favorite was the Pad Thai (one of the worst I've had) and chicken skewers. 

Reason for 2 stars:
After we were seated, our waitress didn't come by for what seemed like 10 minutes to introduce herself. When she came by, she was friendly but did not communicate clearly how she was taking our order. Since it was so loud and our waitress didn't have a very loud voice, 3 different members of our group asked her to clarify how much food she thought we should order. She specifically told us that we should order 3-4 starters and at least 5 main dishes. That took me by surprise b/c I thought this is small plates and how could that be enough food? So I repeated what she said to me just to clarify that 3-4 appetizers would enough food for 10 girls? We decided to just order as much as she recommended and we can order more if necessary. 

When the dishes arrived, we were all suprised at the large portions. What we found out when we got the receipt was that the waitress doubled and tripled each order (as she saw fit) so it would be enough for our table of 9. She NEVER once said she was going to do this and we were upset because we had so much leftover food and even ate more than we wanted so it wouldn't be wasted.

If we had known this is what she was going to do, we would have ordered different items. I can't remember if she tripled any main dishes but the end result was a very large bill and wasted food. 

When we brought this up to our waitress, she insisted she explained it and after she left, she never returned to our table. We then spoke to the manager who said he could only give us 2 drink tokens to compensate for the miscommunication. This is so lame and such a cheap gestere to rectify the situation. The least he could have done was get us into the nightclub for free afterwards. 

I have never, ever, gone to a restaurant where they took the liberty of doubling or tripling your order without telling you. I've always said, I want 1 order of this, 2 orders of this, etc.

I would not go back to this restaurant again. Food was good but not worth the price. 

The club is ok if you get in early but by 1pm it gets too crowded to walk around and check things out. We got free line passes but had to go out, get in smaller line, pay $20pp at the door + get a hand stamp, then headed upstairs to the night club. Seems like a classy place but I find it offensive that they have skanky girls taking baths and playing with each other surrounded by all these bhuddas.

To give one star review it takes a lot. Well, Tao made it. It was the biggest disappointment in my life. I am not a critic, and I don't complain a lot. But this place earned both of them. Giving you a long story will be boring so I am giving you the facts. We spend only 3 days in Vegas, so we tried to make our restaurant "visiting plan" and make a list which restaurant we want to visit. Tao was on the list. So, the time has come and we showed up at the restaurant. The waiting was about 20 minutes. After we been escorted to a tiny table, around us a huge crowd of people with big parties. I am talking about party of 20 or more. So we asked a bottle water while we look at the menu, which came. But later it was constantly ruing with the bus boy by refilling our glass with top water, on the top of our bottled water. 
We placed our order, drinks and food. The drinks came in about 10 minutes later, with some free appetizers. The table was so small we had to move al the things around and accidentally my wife's cocktail ended up on the floor.   
She didn't even touched the drink.  The drink never been replaced or we have never been asked if we like to order an other one.  So after we been waiting like 25-30minutes total, one of the dish came. I was like okay, we gonna wait until we gonna get the other dish. After an other 10-15 minutes with empty glasses we decided to share one dish. The dish was nothing special and the portion was small no to mention it was not even our food. Or it was the food what we ordered nut the menu description was different. Well, on the perfect time just right after we finished one share dish, the other on came. Guess what, the same mistake. It was not we ordered, but very very similar. So after total spend almost 2 hours including waiting time, and shortened with $150 for the wrong dishes, and zero positive experience , I am writing this review and hope it will help people to choice  an other  restaurant where they want to spend their money and time. 
I know it could be a lot of questioning elements, like why we did not tell the, busser or the  server what is happening, but like I said, there is more in the whole story, but I don't want to write a book.  I see there is a lot positive reviews about this place, and this is just my experience, but this review is honest, and not a "payed customer."

Eh.

The best part of this place is the amazing decor and ambiance. Food is just fine, but expensive (vegas nightclub strip restaurant, go figure!). We wanted to try out tao because we were with a couple of dudes and knew we could get into the club without paying for a cover for the guys if we ate dinner there.

Just FYI, you must get an entree which does not include most of the sushi, soups, etc. if you want free access to the club. I kinda think the rule is crap because I wanted a miso soup and sushi roll and was planning on ordering multiple drinks but was told that it didn't qualify as an entree selection. SO I ended up getting something I didn't want as much and ordered less drinks. I really couldn't win here. My recommendation would be spending an amount per person or per table, but I am not an expert. 

We ordered edamame and tempura shrimp and sweet potato as appetizers. Edamame was SUPER spicy, but I am into that sorta thing so it was good. The tempura was average.For my entree I ordered some special sushi roll with tuna or salmon on top, don't remember. If you couldn't tell the sushi roll was very unmemorable to me. It was average sushi that comes with an AYCE joint. However, this suchi roll was $32! My husband got the lobster pad thai which was presented great, but taste was again average to me. 

The highlight of the night was the giant fortune cookie desert that they bring out for celebrations. It was very tasty and great to share. 

Bottom Line: Probably won't be back if it is my job to choose a place, but the food was edible, in a beautiful location, with friendly servers.

My favorite thing about Tao is the ambiance.  The place is immense and finely decorated.  From the moment you walk in, there's just so much eye candy.  From the rose-pedal baths to the giant Buddha and wall of antique opium pipes, the whole place just feels like a place you'd want to be seen in.
As far as sushi goes, the rolls left a lot to be desired, especially at the prices they were fetching for them.  At 30 dollars for their most expensive roll, I would have expected a little more.  However, the nigiri was pretty good, and they had some of the best toro (fatty tuna) I think I've ever had.  Then again, I've never really met a piece of toro I didn't like.  
So, it would be a cool place to go, but not the best sushi I've ever had.  Definitely a place to see and be seen, so dress accordingly.

The best item to order isn't even on the menu: the tasting menu.  I didn't know about this secret the first time I ate there and had wound up ordering the sea bass, which I found to be overly hyped.  The tasting menu consists of a multi-course meal of items selected by the chef depending on your food preferences and your price point ($60-$120 per person).  If you're in town for a short time and don't see yourself visiting again any time soon, the tasting menu is what to request!

The restaurant is beautiful with great ambiance! The wait staff are some of the best in the country!  The food is incredible!  My God, what more could you ask for? I will return over and over again every time I visit Las Vegas.  I think you should too!

I love this place ! Been to both downtown TAO and midtown town in New York and now finally the Vegas one ! Hands down amazing! If u have not tried TAO u don't know what ur missing ! Get there ! Trust me u won't be disappointed!
The food was amazing and there were celebrity spottings everywhere that weekend. I would recommend it but make sure you bring quite a bit of money because it is not cheap

We were a little disappointed that Tao isn't really like the other larger clubs like OMNIA, 1Oak or Hakkasan. It's very small. More lounge type. The DJ isn't very good. The music is bleh. And the dance floor could probably fit 30 people tops. We wanted to try it out to see what it was like, went right when it opened, but it was uncomfortably empty. 2 people were dancing so we walked around, went to the small outside balcony(which was the best part) then left and went to OMNIA. Sorry Tao, you just can't compete with the big guys.

How do I say this, ok the food is mediocre at best. It's not terrible just average and not worth the hefty prices they charge for entrees. The best dish we had was the side of eggplant, it was really tasty and so much of it enough for 5 people. 

The cocktails were good but overpriced as well. 

The best thing I can say about Tao is the service they are very attentive which I'm sure isn't easy considering how dark and loud it is in there. What makes having dinner at Tao worth the money is you get your hand stamped and don't have to stand in the unbelievable line that is waiting to get in the hottest club in Vegas. Once we finished our dinner we went downstairs and out to get in the no-line, line we waited 5 minutes at the most. The club is insane and I'm glad we went to dinner so we could just walk right in. 

Next time I go to Vegas if I want to go to the club again I would go for dinner first, I would definitely go early the crowd is unbelievable. 

If your not planning on going to the club there are better Asian-Fusion restaurants so save your money.

I am Gluten-Free and the trip to Vegas had me in fear I would be eating salads everywhere. TAO was amazing and checked every single ingredient to ensure I was safe. I had the Pepper Steak and my partner had the Sea Bass. They were both delicious. It will cost you to eat here but it will be well worth it. The service here was superb and our waitress made sure our meal was perfect. We will definitely be back!

Tao Restaurant is a pretty nice place.  Really cool environment, good vibe, beautiful layout, etc, etc.  It's also not a bad thing that they don't seat you right away (even if you have reservations)....they have a nice lounge area.

If restaurants were all about the environment, then Tao would get 5 stars.  But alas, this is a review of a restaurant, so the actual food is important too.  Typical asian fusion stuff....a mix of a wide variety of asian dishes.  If you don't know what asian fusion is, think about it this way....you can order sashimi (Japanese), pad thai (thai), satay chicken for appetizers (thai), and then throw down some shrimp, sea bass, spicey tuna rolls, kung pao, etc.  Oh yeah, avoid the sashimi....we're talking 4 small leaflets worth for $60.  The food is decent, but nothing special.  The environment goes along way (great place to take your special someone or a bunch of friends)...but the food is nothing to rave about.  Remember, it's definitely on the pricey end.  If you're considering a few appetizers, some drinks, maybe a bottle of sake, an entree for you and your sweatie, and then some dessert to close the deal, we're talking $100 each, easily.

And please, please don't go here just to get a free line pass for Tao, the club.  It's not worth it.  Why pay $100 per person for a mediocre dinner just to get into the club?  And besides, if you're part of a sausage fest, you'll still have to pay cover and still wait a bit in line.  And if you cheap out on the dinner (where your main motivation was to get into the club and it's obvious), the server doesn't have to hook you up.

And once you're in, you're screwed because Tao is geared towards table service.....unless you enjoy being packed like sardines (well I suppose if there were two girls and you.....).  Anyways, think about it...$100 for dinner, $ for cover, and then a whole bunch of $ for drinks. ...and standing the whole time and being very uncomfortable.  Or spending $200-$250 each person for bottle/table service, depending on how many are in your group.  It's a no brainer.

So back to the Tao restaurant....great environment good vibe, cool place to eat......average food.

Went here on a crowded Saturday night but luckily made a reservation at 7:15 so we were able to get right in. The decor is gorgeous and the service was amazing!! Definitely worth  coming here if you're visiting from out of town. I got the Tao-Tini and shrimp phad Thai.. 5/5 would recommend! Can't wait to come back here next time im in Vegas.

Tough for words to describe.  The evening is an event.  It starts at the bar and then to your table.  It's a very complete menu.  Every item is prepared fresh.  Standouts were the Sand Pot (lobster,scallops, shrimp, and fish ).  The peppercorn filet is excellent. If you like traditional Peking duck you will love this.  The miso glazed sea bass is very different and a standout. For dessert be sure to get the donuts and the stuffed fortune cookie
Overpriced and overrated! Each roll costs $15-20 each and one of our rolls was 2/3 rice. Very disappointed.

I'm surprised by the number of low ratings for this place.  It's pretty difficult getting reservations at Tao less than a couple of days in advance, unless you're fine eating at 9:45.  But for those not staying at the Venetian and want to go to Tao club afterward, dining there will get you a vip pass to skip the long lines.

Now the food part. The lobster wontons were AMAZING.  I know it sounds odd, but every bite was like a taste of lobster heaven.  The sauce concoction was just incredibly delicious. I also had curry chicken and sirloin steak (forgot the correct entree names), which were good but not great. I guess without the lobster wontons, I'd give Tao a 3 star.

My only complaint about Tao is the incense or whatever it is that blasts you when you walk in the door.  Once my lungs adjusted and I stopped feeling like I was about to have an asthma attack (note: I don't have asthma.. thats how much smokey smelly craziness in the air), the rest of the dining experience was lovely.

I tried both the chilean sea bass with miso glaze and the peppered filet with udon noodles.  Both dishes were absolutely amazing.  When I think of Asian food and beef, I think tough and overcooked.  The filet was so tender and flavorful.  Right after I ordered it, I was regretting my decision thinking that it was going to be mundane and that I should have gone for something more adventurous, but the dish had wonderful complex flavors that took it way beyond what you would think a beef and noodle dish would be.  The sea bass was so flavorful.  I have tried chilean sea bass many times before, and I have always been put off by the flavor.  This was done right, the miso glaze was amazing.

Our drinks were great, our party of four all selected different cocktails so we could sample each others drinks.  All of them were delicious.  My favorite was the Tao Love Potion #9. 

For desert we shared the giant fortune cookie filled with white chocolate and dark chocolate mouse with fresh fruit.  Kind of cheesy, but it was really tasty and the fortunes were pretty funny.

Aside from food and drink, the restaurant decor is beautiful and the service was great, would definitely recommend this to anyone visiting Las Vegas.

Bullshit! Waited 45 min after reservation time and left w/o being seated. NOT customer friendly. I don't care if the food is good if management can't handle their clientele.  Added note: TAO did call me back the next day to apologize & asked us to return with their compliments. That is appreciated. TBC!!!
Great night at Tao!  We had Sea Bass, Sausage Fried Rice, Dan Dan Noodles, and Lobster Wonton. All great. Amazing service from Sherolyn!  Highly recommend.

Good Asian Bistro in the Venetian. We ate family style and tried a whole bunch of things, the yellowtail sashimi really stood out. Service was decent, ambiance is good but dark and loud, so only go there if that's what you want. And bring your checkbook- it's not cheap.

My daughter and I celebrated her 18th Birthday in Las Vegas and decided to dine at Tao for dinner which is located inside the Venetian Hotel....Dining here was a great way to end her Birthday Shenanigans.... our waitress Emily & waiter Treyvon aka Trey was very attentive and professional.... I travel a lot and dine at many restaurants and I enjoy giving credit to where credit is due!!! We will definitely be back!!! Thanks for adding to my daughter's 18th Birthday Celebration

Food:
Delicious! Wagyu beef, salmon, fried rice and so much more. We ordered the chefs choice and got to try a bit of everything. It is a LOT of food, so you could probably share it.

Price/ value:
It's Vegas, so it'll be pricey. For the quality of the food and service, it's better than some Vegas restaurants, though still on the higher end.

Ambiance:
Really cool, club like. There are the tubs full of rose petals on your way in. There was a DJ spinning old school hip hop. We had to wait for a table because it was packed. The bar is good for this.

Service:
Our server was nice and attentive. 

**Let them know it's your birthday and they will give you a giant fortune cookie 'cake' with fruit and chocolate. It's big enough to share with your group and super cool.

There's a club section. We got stamps to go next door for free, not sure the qualifications for that though. We did rack up a hefty bill, but we also went later in the evening.

TAO is amazing...  We had the Cucumber Mojito pitcher to start off our dinner, so delicious.  The Drunken Pad Thai is a must order, as is the Sea Bass.  So good!  The lighting is very dim, but perfect for the atmosphere in the restaurant.  Service was great, as well.

I'd recommend eatting at TAO before heading up to their nightclub. It will definitely get you in the mood since the vibe in their lounge carries through to the dining area.  The Asian fusion menu is tasty, but not as creative in flavor as such places as Nobu.

On our way into the Tao Nightclub and we decide to grab a late dinner (more like a breakfast of sorts).  The atmosphere was beautiful.  A large 3 story Buddha statue and DJ oversee a faux converted warehouse full of beautiful people.  

The sashimi trio left much to be desired.  Though the wasabi salsa was delectable, the poor portion size made this dish way overpriced in comparison to other Japanese food venues.  Think deli thin sliced. A sampling of the vegetarian fried rice and Chicken Satay with peanut sauce saved Tao from total shame.  

My suggestion? Eat before you get to the club and save your money for the drinks.

Drinks: Awesome!
Food:  Wonderful!
Service: Great!
Atmosphere: Fun!

You need to come here when you are in Vegas. This place is awesome. I have not had a single dish here that was not amazing. This place is perfect for an intimate date night, or a family gathering. 

We usually like to get a bunch of different small dishes and eat family style. A bunch of sushi rolls, some tempura, a couple of side dishes, and you are set! Whatever you do, please make sure you save room for dessert!! They have a chocolate zen parfait (with godiva chocolate in it!) and chocolate spring rolls for all you chocolate lovers out there! Yumm!!

Fantastic food and good (albeit not speedy) service. The waiter was very friendly and happy to make recommendations. They were very accommodating of my dietary needs (vegan) and I ended up getting the kung pao chicken with tofu instead of chicken. They also allowed me to substitute brown rice. The place is absolutely gorgeous...worth the money!!

Dined here with my wife over a long weekend and to quickly summarize the experience, we both loved it...everything from the decor, the service, and of course, the meal was top notch.

We booked an early reservation around 5:30pm after being sold on reviews of both the original Tao in New York and this one. 

TIP: Book reservations early since the choice times fill quickly on the weekends. 

My first impressions of Tao's decor looks like money well spent...especially in the details. Upon entry, we noticed tubs filled with water and rose petals...to which my wife replied, Can we get in? I told her, sure ;) It also created an intoxicating scent...or perhaps that was the drinks?

Our table was nicely situated on the second level which overlooked the giant Buddah and coy fish pond. This was a great location since it was above the group tables noise and was quiet enough to have a decent conversation of sweet-nothings and what-nots. My wife also pointed out from this vantage point, you can see down some girls tops...I resisted to look as I felt I was being tested.

Our server, Michael, was tremendously helpful with our dining experience. His fantastic recommendations with the sashimi, the vegetarian selections, and the strong, yet fine Tao cocktails were spot on.

I also liked how the other staff members went the extra mile in making the dining experience special. Our water glasses were always full, and empty dishes were promptly removed. They also gave us a line pass for the nightclub upstairs. This was great in avoiding the long lines even as they opened at 10pm.

Another helpful TIP is the Yin/Yang signage on the restroom doors. Here's a helpful primer...

Yin = Feminine forces
Yang = Masculine forces

Clever, huh?

This took my wife and I awhile to figure out, especially after a few drinks. They even included male and female statues...and the occasional male attendant peeping out from time to time...to help the confused or drunkards.

It is a bit on the expensive side but well worth it. Overall, we enjoyed Tao so much and found ourselves craving the food the next day. I'm sure we'll be back.

I've heard so much about Tao in the past and didn't take the time to visit during my last trip to Vegas... This time around, we made it a point to check it out. We were a group of 8 and made a reservation on the same day. I was very surprised they were able to accommodate us with a same day reservation.

We arrived on time and they escorted us to a sitting area while they finished getting our table ready. Only took about 10 minutes and while we waited we were quickly approached for a drink order. The drinks came out right away while we all enjoyed taking in the very lavish decor.

I think we were very fortunate with our service, our waiter, TJ, was EXCELLENT! We ordered everything family style and aside from the dishes we asked for, TJ made some great suggestions.

Everything came out cooked to perfection. I still had a lot of food restrictions to follow and TJ was very attentive to making sure I didn't feel left out and explained which dishes I would be able to eat. Overall, incredible experience! Will definitely return on our next trip to Vegas.

Tao was definitely a fun experience as so many people talk about it I felt like I had to go when I visited Vegas in March. The food was pretty good though I don't know that I would say it was memorable. I got a basic filet mignon lo mein dish. The fortune cookie dessert was the best part! It's a huge cookie at least 4 people can share and each person gets a fortune. Although two of us got the same fortune so oh well. Our table was on the second level which was nice as we were able to look out over the entire restaurant. The only other drawback I would mention is that's it's dim as heck in there. My interior photo had the flash on so it looks brighter than it actually is, but there were multiple tables using their phone flashlight to read the menu. I guess it's just part of the sultry ambience they are trying to create. I have to say my friends and I got somewhat dressed up to eat here as we read it was a "dressy" restaurant. Upon arrival I don't know that I would still say it's dressy as I saw people in sweats/jogging sweat suits others in jeans and sneakers or people in hoodies (not just young people either :\). Did make me wonder why not try to look nice when dining at a nice restaurant but oh well I'm not reviewing the diners. Overall it was a good experience the staff is super friendly.

The only thing nice was that eating at Tao allowed us to get into the club for free and no waiting in line.  

I had the salmon with udon & spinach which sounded great.  I had the salmon medium rare and it was as expected.  The udon was a little salty.  It was hard to hear people speaking with the club music bleeding over to the restaurant.  The service was pretty good and the overall menu had a pretty good selection of food.

Service began slow, but soon picked up. Most everything we ordered was delish! We saw Tao on "must eat" places on the food channel - as the focused on the Chilean Sea Bass. Although I appreciate the guide through the making of the dish, it was really just Miso Butterfish. Lobster Won Ton in Ginger Shiitake Broth was yum!
I'd come again.

The ambiance is nice and I like that we got special access to the nightclub... But the food?  I expected much more for what we paid.  I got the Shrimp Pad Thai which was more like a soup loaded with bean sprouts.  My boyfriend got the Orange Chicken which was a small serving and nothing special.  Yes, we got basic items... but we at least expected it to taste better than Pei Wei or PF Changs.  The fortune cookies were funny.  That's all.  We'll go somewhere else next time.  We were also guests at the hotel so a discount would had been nice.

Tao was excellent.  If you are in Vegas, I definitely recommend heading over to the Venetian and treating yourself to a good meal.  We went to dinner on a Saturday night around 6 with a part of 6, and didn't have to wait for a table.  I got the Chicken Pad Thai and loved every second of it.  I think it was around $20-$23.  My boyfriend got the Filet Pepper Steak, and it might back been one of the best things I've ever tried.  The seasoning was perfect and the steak was so tender, I can't say enough good things.  I think that entree was $24-$28.  Definitely worth the price.

The service was good too, there were multiple people checking on us throughout the meal and refilling waters and drinks.  The manager stopped by to check on us as well.  Check it out!

Previously dined at Tao on numerous occasions and had a satisfactory experience.  This time was different.

Made a reservation for an 8 o'clock dinner for two.  Arrived at 8 and the host informed us that it would "be a while."  Waited in the lounge to be seated for 45 minutes before we decided to leave.  I informed the host that we had been waiting 45 minutes past our reservation and still hadn't been seated.  He did not acknowledge me.  No apology, no explanation, not even a glance in my direction.  Carried on with his business, whatever his business may be--it certainly doesn't involve hosting duties.  

Despite having dined here before and having an overall positive experience, due to this most recent experience I will no longer be dining at Tao.

Ate here for dinner and was pleasantly surprised!
-Food: My party ordered family style and everything we ate was high-quality, fresh, and delicious. There were so many fantastic flavors with each item. They also have a great selection which made it hard to choose. If you like seafood you will be in luck
-Ambiance: Romantic and fun although a bit dark when reading the menu
-Staff: The host was a little rude but our waiter was great with recommendations and being accomodating
-Prices: Fair for what you get
-Location: Convenient since it's close to the entrance of the hotel but close enough to enjoy what the hotel has to offer
-Overall: I would definitely come back here next time! Nom!

I don't understand the hype about their sea bass dish.
I had the same dish in many other local Asian restaurants (LA) that tasted much better and cost half the price.

The restaurant is beautiful and the service was good.

We came with a party of 9; we ate like crazy and drank like crazy and the bill was under 600. Not bad at all.

Service was great took a bit to get the bill but, that was the only complaint we had. I was very impressed with ambiance and the amount of people working there. Drinks never got low and there was always someone right at our table in all black checking in on us. Food was delish and the sake was AMAZING! If you are looking for a great dinner in Las Vegas I highly recommend. If you are a large party be aware even for a massive restaurant they only have a limited amount of tables that can accommodate a party of 8. 

Enjoy! (photos loaded of yummy sake)

What's a good way to complement a night at the club? A dinner at a fine restaurant, of course! Tao is not only my favorite club in Vegas, but it hosts my favorite restaurant as well. This place is an Asian-fusion restaurant, and the meal and environment is well worth the price. 
I ordered my favorite dinner dish, filet mignon. I had this with fried onions, a side of white jasmine rice, and a redbull-vodka. The meal was delicious, and my buddies ordered some pretty good stuff as well (check the photos). We shared a plate of cauliflower, which was pan friend with a great combination of spices.
The waitress and staff were friendly, efficient, and ensured an excellent experience. Thanks for marking a great start to our night of debauchery!

Give them a try.

Is it fair for me to review a restaurant just based on the bar scene? Stopped in for a few drinks with the wife on a wed night (dead). Nice lounge feel to the front, cool music and the mood lighting created a nice relaxing atmosphere. 

Drinks were super strong; but so was the bill! $28 for two well drinks and ouch!!!

This place gets uber packed on a friday or saturday night so remember to bring your patience. Flagging down one of the bartenders can become a rather trying , and frustrating task. Oh yeah, sometimes they stick women in these bathtubs up from for a "sexy" look the club. Kind of odd, but still cool nevertheless

So after promising myself I wouldn't come back to Tao to eat, here I am again with my fiance because it was 1130 pm at night and Tao is one of the few restaurants still open. Unless you want to eat McD or Panda Express of course...which ain't nothing wrong with that. 

We got good service but the waiter was SO PUSHY about ordering drinks. Sir, it's almost midnight and we plan to go to bed after this meal, we do not want your specialty rose flavored cat sake no matter if it's in season! 

We ordered:

Chicken gyoza pan fried - super delicious. Great with the barely sweet soy sauce it came with. 
Beijing duck for two - freshly sliced duck with crispy skin and crisp scallions on the side. Plum sauce was good and did not overwhelm. moo shi pancakes were freshly made and melted in your mouth. 

So a good meal, although it is a bit pricy for the value of the food. I don't know what it is about Tao, but it's also busy so it takes FOREVER to get your food. We got our appetizer in 25 min and then another 20 min wait for the duck after that. 

Kept our waters refilled and our dishes cleared. I guess I'd come back again for lunch, dinner just takes too long. 

Very very loud and dark.
Friendly staff. Decent food spoiled with NYC Tao I guess there is just no place like home

We waited 20 minutes to order, then they forgot the first part of our order, and they didn't try and make up for the poor service with taking care of a drink or something. This place really is not very good. They sold us over the phone on a Pre-theater Phantom menu, then we we got there they said they didn't have such a menu. It was really a joke. People in Vegas must be used to shitty service because I will never spend my money here again.

I have eaten at both TAOs in Las Vegas and NYC many times. Delish! 

The decor is similar in both establishments (large stone buddha, lots of red and black). Service has always been on point and it's great for groups because the atmosphere is loud and fun.

Some of my favorite menu items are:

-cloudy sake
-lychee martini
-salmon sashimi appetizer (with jalepeno)
-crispy rice (which has tuna on it)
-miso-glazed sea bass
-giant fortune cookie

Some of their menu items are also found on TAO Beach's menu.

Oh, and remember to always read your fortune out loud and end it with "in the bed."

The sushi I ordered was very good, but that's about it. The menu is EXTREMELY overpriced. So overpriced that the good sushi and rice isn't enough to bring it up to 2 stars. If I hadn't come here with gift cards I'd have been super pissed. The food would be 2- or maybe 3-star material if it was 1/3 the price, because given the quality of the filet mignon in my main dish I promise you it wasn't worth the $40 they're asking. Serving sizes are also small at any price, but especially for the prices they charge.

The filet is actually 7 or 8 very small pieces of meat, maybe the size of a McDonalds chicken nugget. The whole dish is covered in an extremely artificial just-came-out-of-a-box tasting sauce, and the peppers lack flavor. The chicken that my fianc√© ordered had potential and she was happy with the way it was cooked, but it was overall "only okay" as she says. I had a taste and hated it, but that was just the flavor. Not something I would have ordered. Also, I was probably jaded by my garbage steak already.

We ordered a side of pork fried rice also. This was a semi-bright spot on the night. The rice was very good, and there were a lot of vegetables which we liked. Big fans of veggies. But the pork in the rice was bad. It was small chunks and also tasted and felt like it had come right out of a box and popped into the microwave.

Now the sushi was amazing. I don't remember what it was called but it was their special for the day or week or something, and included salmon, real crab, avocado, caviar, ginger (I think), and a spicy-ish sauce. This roll was absolutely delicious, and I devoured it in like 5 minutes.

As a side note, the service was good. The waitress could have stopped by a little more frequently but it wasn't a big deal overall. She was very nice and our order was correct and our drinks were eventually filled.

I have money left on my gift card after paying $150 for some of the most mediocre, fast-food level, processed tasting, overall low quality steak I've had in a long time. I'll use it for sushi or drinks but after it's used up I definitely won't be back.

Not the best of what I had at my expectations. It's more average tasting then what I seemed to see but it was enough to satisfy me. But because Tao is always spoken of as so highly I did expect better. The giant fortune cookie is fun though!

I give this place 3 stars because the food is good not awesome but the price is defintely meant for killer food. I only paid for the food to avoid the club cover charge. If you're only looking for a nice dinner I suggest going to another restaurant in the Venetian, wolf gang has a few good ones around the area.

What to get: chocolate spring rolls with kalamansi sauce, and giant fortune cookie filled with vanilla & chocolate ice cream

Nice decors, pricey, smaller portions, and the entree meals were just-okay.. the cocktails were also nothing special, however they truly shine in the dessert department. Our waiter was very friendly and nice, we got there early before the queue and was able to get in quickly. One thing I find laughable is that you have to tip in the restroom.
Service and food is always extraordinary at Tao! I make it a point to eat here every time I visit LV. The Chilean SeaBass appy is to die for! I have never been disappointed -- worth the money!

An underwhelming experience.
Service was good, as you would expect in a nice hotel but food was alright.
Spicy dumpling soup was very limey. Did not like it.
Dragon lobster thai pad was on par. 
I have been pf chang once and i would have not been able to tell the difference except Tao had a fancier interior inside.

Tao is one of those places that you feel is a must whenever you're in Vegas. In my opinion, it is one of those places that is a bit overrated.

My friends & I had reservations for 10PM at Tao about two Fridays ago to celebrate a friends birthday. When we first walked in we had to make a line in order to have our IDs checked. It was extremely crowded & noisy as we made our way up the line. Once inside we were given a beeper that would alert us when our table was ready. During that time we were waiting around & people kept rushing/pushing past us to get upstairs to the club.

Let me get to the service & food. After we were seated we had a friendly waiter who suggested a couple of the restaurant's signature dishes. I discretely told him the fact that it was my friend's birthday in order for them to bring out a cake or special dessert for her (which they did - a mousse filled fortune cookie). He was great and started stating some random facts about the club after I whispered in his ear so she wouldn't catch on. So kudos to that. Service all around was AMAZING.

The food was decent. Honestly, what stood out to me was the miso glazed sea bass. I could have ate that & that alone all night long. Everything else was okay from the noodles to the several appetizers we did try out. I can't remember everything we ordered exactly.

If you're trying to go to the nightclub & are in the mood to eat something before hand then you should come check it out for yourself. With the purchase of an entree you don't have to pay the cover charge for the club.

Will I be back? Not likely.

THE FOOD I GIVE 5 STARS

first time I had Kobe beef years ago, that was amazing and im hooked on kobe now, and get it whenever i get the chance at a restaurant. its like crack lol

giving it a star less than perfect because the music is way too freaking loud

if I pay $100 or more for dinner I don't want gay techno music blaring in my ears while i eat...only bad thing

UNBELIEVABLE RESTAURANT. 

I ate here 3x (okay I was in Vegas for 14 days....) once with my husband (they sat us upstairs, alongside the glass so we overlooked the 1st floor and the huge statue, another time with a large group (13 ppl) and a 3rd time with my 2 friends. 

Each and every time-- the meal was amazing. The sushi and sashimi is so unbelievably delicious. By far the BEST sushi I've ever had. The ambiance is inviting-- that dark, lounge feel with upbeat music. 

MAKE A RESERVATION - and early! We tried to get a reservation for a Friday night (our fault for not calling earlier....) couldn't get one until 11:15 PM. We went earlier and had to wait about 35 mins, not tooo bad. We had a drink before hand - I had the something "lily", it's vodka, chambord, and pineapple juice - wow, amazing! 

And great customer service. Maybe even too much, slightly. There is always someone at your table filling up water or clearing plates, which can get a tad annoying (particularly for my date night experience w/ my husband).

We went to Tao on a Thursday night with 13 people to celebrate my husband's birthday. We had such an amazing meal and service - everything exceeded our expectations! I would highly recommend this restaurant!!

Fun place, fast service, great customer service, cool atmosphere, delicious food, beautiful decor.  When in 'Vegas, this is one place you have to eat and party in club upstairs.  Will definitely be back!  Will recommend anyone to go.
One of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas. Amazing food and service.

Eh.  I walked in to Tao drunk.  Way too drunk and I think sushi was a bad move, but I was hungry and craving spicy tuna.  The waiter was good looking, the ambiance was typical and the food was nothing memorable.  I did try the lobster dumplings to start and those were very good, but the sushi was just okay.  The drinks, not that I had needed anymore were very, very good.

Sushi was card board thickness and at $5+ per piece I think that was kinda expensive for what I received.   The place was hopping so I assume we are all idiots for spending so much $ on so little food.  I will admit even though the serving size was small the food was good.  Not good enough for the bill in my humble opinion.

$47 check, paid with $100 bill and my change is 2*$20 one $10 and two singles.  Tempted to leave the $2 as the tip but I am not that much of an asshole.  Lost another star for poor customer service.

We had dinner reservations for 11:30pm. Yes, people like to eat at 11:30m aka after my bed time. When we got there it was like a chicken coop with chickens scrambling around with their necks cut off. It was packed tight. Just to get to the podium to check into 30 mins. Right in front of me was a guy who cut the line, and did that bribe in hand thing to get a table. I saw it with my very own eyes. The hosts played stupid and pretended that they were returning customers. Please. I know how it is. There was a bar in front and the restaurant was towards the back. Odd to me, to have clubbers and people eating at the same time. Our server was nice and was attentive with everything. The music from the club was pretty good. I didn't imagine myself actually eating a meal in a club type atmosphere, but it was upbeat and something different. The food was okay. Sushi was pretty good. The hot and sour soup was probably the best I've ever had. The lobster dumplings were also very good. The sauce it came in was perfect. The drinks were surprisingly tasty. Enough alcohol for you not to complain about it yet still had the flavors of the drink. Wasn't too expensive, which was good on my pocketbook. The d√©cor was beautiful. The center Buddha was divine and a def picture opp. It was where I got my first Vegas kiss from a total stranger. =) 

Note to men who want kisses from women at a tourist deathtrap: 

Guy: Can you girls take a pic with me?
Girls: Yea, okay.
*picture get taken*
Girl #1: Okay you can move now
Guy: I will move if you give me a kiss on the check
Girl #1: Yea okay.
*moves in for kiss on check*
Guy: turns his head and plants one on the girls lips.
Girl #1: SNEAKY! Can't hate you for that..that was a good one!
The glazed white fish dish was on point. Lots of rice in their sushi roll. Trendy atmosphere. I enjoyed myself but didn't go overboard here.

My reviews are all about value.  That does not mean I do not appreciate hip or trendy, though.  But even with the "trendy charge" factored in, this restaurant was still too pricey, so I am giving it only 2 stars.

There is a difference between being hip and pretentious, and Tao errs on the wrong side of that fine line.  I can't quite figure out why, but it just doesn't have the same spirit as Buddha Bar in Paris, a restaurant with similar theme.

$15 for a piece of Otoro sashimi is just too much.

Will definitely be coming here next time my girls and I hit up vegas. This place is sooo yummy. There is a lot of hype around this place simply because celebrities come here and what not, so i was hoping it would be good, but was having my doubts. All have been washed away and this is a must have every time im in vegas!
The only good thing about this place is the design and auora. Food is overpriced and really basic if anything. Will NOT be back.

Very good Asian cuisine. The atmosphere and service were superb. I had the red curry scallops. They were cooked perfectly. The sushi is very fresh. My only criticism is; the portion size is not adequate given the price.

Glad I wasn't paying for it. Service was excellent, and the food was fine. I have to admit, I'm a Chinese-food snob, having grown up amongst some of the best Chinese and Polynesian cuisine on the East Coast, so take my review with a grain of salt (or drop of soy sauce). Every dish was fine, but nothing was standout, and therein lies my complaint. If you're the most fashionably trendy Asian restaurant on the Strip, shouldn't you have at least one dish that's memorable not for its presentation but its flavor? Nothing was over the top, even my carnivorous friends admitted as much.

The decor was, of course, Vegas fab. Love the ginormous Buddha and carved lighting fixtures. But at our table of 10, where was the ubiquitous Lazy Susan? That was sorely missing, and added some aggravation -- as well as spills -- to our meal.

Nos llam√≥ la atenci√≥n una tienda estilo budista que estaba en el hotel Venetian, y cuando miramos hacia un lado pues nos dimos cuenta que era la tienda de souvenirs de un restaurant.

El sitio creo que puedo decir de los mejores que he visto en cuanto a decoraci√≥n, iluminaci√≥n, mobiliario  y ambiente, si te gusta la onda budista-asi√°tica este local lo tienes que visitar.

En la entradas unas ba√±eras de piedra con p√©talos de rosa te dan la antesala a lo que vas a ver adentro.

Tienen una estatua gigante dentro que seguro le tomaras fotos.

No es un sitio caro para el lugar donde est√° y la decoraci√≥n que tiene. La atenci√≥n fue muy especial tambi√©n , de hecho hasta la manager se nos acerc√≥ a preguntarnos c√≥mo iba todo y eso es un gran detalle.

Comimos de entrada langostinos empanizados que estaban muy buenos, luego pedimos sushi y un arroz frito especial con camarones y pollo que estaba genial.

Muy bueno. Y en la tienda te aseguro que compras algo porque no es muy caro, las camisetas las vas a amar
Nice place, great atmosphere, spring rolls were great, lobster Cali roll was ok.   Service good.  Real cool place

I was in town with some friends from overseas. Wanted them to try out some "upscale" food.. Few people recommended this place. Since it was inside venetian, why not try it out.

The environment and surroundings were awesome, you can't ask for more. But for some reason, the food.... horrible. Absolutely horrible. Almost every dish came out either too salty or sweet. How do you screw up white rice? They did. 

I figure, chinese fusion would be a nice concept for them to try. Something more upscale than PF Chang's. Aside from the fact that the food looks like art, to be honest, Panda Express is better.

2 star for the ambiance.
Like this place. Went there last night for a Bday celebration. The waiter CJ was great.  It's always customer service that makes the dining experience even better

We dined with a group of 6 and really looked forward to an amazing experience since I had heard so much about their menu and incredible flavors.  When our waiter arrived he tried to explain their signature dishes as well as his personal favorites.  Everyone basically wanted a tasting menu but a couple of people had specific dietary restrictions.  That said, we all started the first course which came out with 6-7 different dishes which we shared family style.  Actually full at that moment our waiter came out with 3 large platters of rolls and sashimi.  Not knowing what to do we all started to eat it because it was a part of the "tasting menu".  Feeling very uncomfortable and more than full, our waiter said that he was coming with the dessert.  At that time we all said "please don't!"  What was supposed to be a great dining experience turned into the waiter not realizing that the tasting menu should have been changed to accommodate a normal person's appetite.  Seriously it was way too much food for 6 people and probably could have served 12.  Sorry Tao but the 3 stars are for inappropriate ordering for your guests not for flavor which by the way was amazing!!

We wanted to have a taste of the Vegas clubbing scene without going through too much trouble (yes, we're not the Ibiza diehards we once were) so we thought of going to Tao, which is conveniently located in the Venetian, just a skip and hop away from our suite at the Palazzo. Having dinner at Tao gets you easy entry into the club, which was perfect for us since we needed to eat and hate lining up. We showed up for our 9:15 reservation and instead of being seated were handed a buzzer to let us know when the table was ready. I realized this meant there would be a wait so we sat at the bar and ordered two Kirins (the bartender looked slightly disappointed that we didn't want cocktails but it's 2016 and I don't do lychee martinis anymore). The wait wasn't exactly short but not long enough for us to finish our beers. When we were finally seated, our attentive server Mike told us the specials and we were immediately sold on the pastrami fried rice. We also ordered lobster wontons with shiitake ginger broth and Chinese five spice short ribs. I honestly didn't have very high expectations but it was all pretty tasty and we were quite satisfied. We ended our dinner with key lime doughnuts, another yummy special. After we settled our check, we asked Mike about access to the club and a lady and black soon came over to stamp us wrists for entry. We then just had to go back out to the entrance to have our IDs checked, then we circled right back into the club - no lines, no muss, no fuss. I've had far more difficult entries to Tao before so I thought this was a really great deal. The club experience itself was not super stellar - the DJ seemed to have a playlist from 5 years ago - so we left after just one round of drinks. But it was well worth having a good dinner and a brief club interlude just to round out our Vegas experienc
What a meal.  Service was slow and you can certainly find cheaper places but the food was out of this world.  Wait staff steered us towards great choices.

I think you go here more for the atmosphere than the food although the food was still good.  it wasn't spectacular for the price but the surroundings made up for it.  the dim lighting still accentuated all of the great asian inspired decor.  the magnificent sized statue in the middle of the dining room really set the tone for the place.  the service was attentive and good.  the noise level was a little high because of the club upstairs but otherwise, it was a fine restaurant.

Tao is a chic, dim lit asian place at the Venetian. The entrance is lined up with empty bathubs filled with water and flowers. When you walk in and pass the lounge into the restaurant, a large Buddha statue welcomes you into this beautiful restaurant. I went here before catching a show & loved my food!
I ordered:
appetizer- veggie dumplings (sauteed ginger & sesame seeds)
entree- Sushi--spicy tuna, salmon, & asparagus roll. (it was amazing) 
dessert- white choc/raspberry fried wontons w/ icecream

*warning*- no free refills. 4 bucks for a glass of sprite filled with ice? eh. Anyhow, the ambiance is trendy, the service was quick, the food was delicious & overall..was a great first night out during my vegas trip this past weekend!

make sure you have reservations well in advance!
Exceptional service, great sea bass, tasty fortune cookie. Well worth the visit. All round 5 star.

***We had a large party menu (fixed) at Tao's and that could have contributed to the experience; the food was mediocre with some of the courses being decent, but more of them with a quality and flavor similar to a PF Chang's***

Tao has never been high on my list to try in Las Vegas, but I've definitely heard a lot about it--especially since it is both a restaurant and, I believe, a nightclub after dinner ends.  Tao was also featured on the Food Network's Best Thing I Ever Ate where Duff Goldman selected their satay of Chilean sea bass as his favorite thing in Las Vegas.

Tao is located in The Venetian and it is a big spot with a dark decor (very loud as well).  Tao's huge menu is very modern Asian or Asian fusion with a wide variety of items including sushi, sashimi, edamame, satay, tuna tartare, hot and sour soup, dumplings, spring rolls, BBQ meats, tempura, wok-fried meat, poultry and seafood dishes, fried rice, and noodles.

Everything was kind of okay, but while a few dishes were noticeably better than what you would get at a PF Chang's, a lot of it wasn't (and Tao carries a much higher price tag though part of that is because Tao is in Las Vegas).  We did have a fixed party menu so maybe more freshly prepared dishes would have stood out more though the flavors were not exciting or memorable.

Service was fine.  The food came out at a good pace.

As mentioned, prices were high for a just okay Asian fusion restaurant.

Tao does offer many different dishes and it brings in a lot of customers to make for a lively atmosphere so if either of those two qualities appeal to you, Tao might be worth checking out.  But if you are looking for high quality food or good value, Tao might not be the best choice on The Strip.

Like other Las Vegas casinos on The Strip, The Venetian offers both free self and valet parking.

This place was surprisingly good. The interior is beautiful with Asian influences, spacious, simple yet elegant, and very dim. The service was very good and timing of the dishes perfect! Atmosphere was nice and seems like a nice, trendy, romantic place.

- Spicy Tuna on Crispy Rice: good, rice was crispy, sauce good
- Filet Mignon Udon Noodles: delicious beef, noodles were good, balanced peppery flavor
- Seafood Claypot: saucy, variety of seafood, scallops were excellent

Everything was good and not overly seasoned as most fusion places do it. Service was great and the atmosphere was nice. Quite a pleasant surprise as I did not expect this hot club spot to have such good food.

This is the only place in the world wherein they want people to fill and fax a lengthy form to get a table booking for 8-10 people. And mind it I was offering my credit card details on the phone but as per them unless you fill a lengthy form and fax it, they won't make a reservation. Do they know that world has moved ahead?

They have worst attitude and thus a total skip for me

So I went to Vegas to celebrate my 21st Birthday! Woo (bleepppppp'n) hooooo!!!!!!

 I choose to have my Bday dinner @ TAO & was a bit disappointed :-( 

The restaurant itself was amazingly beautiful. The food was just okay. I don't remember what the exact names of our dishes were but I had sea bass and my boyfriend had something with saut√©ed beef. Nothing special, but the California rolls were pretty good. Our drinks were good (can't remember what those were either, lol Vegas+alcohol = forgetfulness). However, I do remember that overall, the food was okay, the drinks were okay, and restaurants decor was gorgeous, and I don't remember our waiter either so they were probably just ok. 

They did surprise me with a giant fortune cookie with fruit since it was my Birthday and that was very sweet, that's where my extra star comes Iol, if it wasn't for that, I would have given it 3 stars.

Didn't go to the nightclub but hopefully next time I'll check it out. I would go back to the restaurant for its apitizers and drinks, not sure about the food.

If you come with a date or small group then you just won't get the experience. I usually always wait until 2(+) visits yo make a review. My 2nd time eating here was nothing short of amazing. I hosted a bachelor party for my best friend with a group of 16. We didn't order one thing, I told the waiter to bring out his favorite dishes "family" style with big plates in the middle. Sake, drinks etc...EVERYTHING. 14 out of the 16 guys said this was the best meal of their life..Not just because of the amazing new twist they have perfected with Asain cuisine/french techniques, but the service was impeccable.
