1 star for grand bathroom and the giant 40 foot wall of a candles that marks it's entrance.
....i'm sure the food is fine, i'm not really a fan of asian food actually, but you just have to see this place, go for a drink

Stipulations:  If you don't have the money, don't spend any here...I was treated to this place on 2 seperate occasions and I would never pay this much for drinks or food.  I don't "high-roll" and I don't want to act like it...this is one of few places on the strip I would ever frequent...get my ass back to Fremont Street!

First impression right off the bat when they seated us way in the back next to the kitchen door and busboy station, was not a good sign! We made reservations for this? After I complained, we were then seated next to the DJ and across from noisy bar! It took all my willpower not to walk out because I've read some great reviews and was looking forward to our dining experience. Big mistake! 

The restaurant is huge with many levels of seating for dining and had a club atmosphere and not conducive to enjoying great Asian cuisine chatting with friends. This place definitely caters mostly to the nightclub set. And it was only 7:15pm and people at the bar were over the top! 

After waiting for about 40 minutes (unacceptable) we ordered our food. Since it was hard to have a normal conversation with my husband during dinner  we ate in silence and got out of there as soon as we could. This Foodie is not used to this kind of treatment! 

By the time the food arrived we were starving so we dug into the Peking Duck Spring Rolls with Hoison sauce which was very flavorful and we both enjoyed it. Thank goodness! However it was the only dish that was good out of the 3 dishes we ordered! The Crispy Coconut Shrimp with THAI Peanut Sauce ($33.00 for 6 medium shrimp) was pricey and I did like the flavor of the peanut sauce with the shrimp but my husband said to him they were just uninteresting. 

I did like the flavor of our 3rd dish Mandarin Fried Rice with roasted Pork however my husband said it reminded him of Panda Express at 5 times the cost! 

With all the many choices in restaurants in Las Vegas this restaurant does not get our vote and we will not be back!

Courtland Is by far the best server ever ever had. I have over 12 years in the hospitality and specifically serving at four star above restaurants, and her service and care was above and beyond anything I've experienced. I have hefty food allergies and she had went through a patient process to ensure that I was not only taken care of, but also served exquisite foods. We will be back exclamation
Great food. Affordable prices. Awesome service and free entry to the night club = a five star rating

This Tao is one of the things that makes Vegas bearable for me. The decor (by my friend Thomas) is spectacular- the club part is just gorgeous- Buddhas everywhere (ok, a bit too much beaucoup de Buddha), Asian antiques, big stone tubs filled with floating rose petals- the sheer scale of the thing is amazing.

That said, of COURSE it is obnoxious. This is Vegas baby, and this place is very popular.  So, you'll need a res for sure, and even then you will wait, and the waitron will treat you as though you are an enthused tourist who just can't wait for that exotic experience. It's not quite as bad as "Would you like some Sake? It's Japanese rice wine, and by the way, some of the fish here is raw", but...almost. HOWEVER the sake selection is excellent and shows good taste in a sake sommelier ( a big career ambition of mine), the cocktails are strong, and the food is decent. 

It is worth visiting just for the upstairs bathrooms, which are completely transparent until you lock the door- then they cloud up (a trick also used in the NYC Prada store, but they don't serve sake). An interesting psychological test.

It's gorgeous. Asian themed club-like setting, buddha-inspired, candles everywhere.  No one in their right mind would not like it.  I've been to Tao Asian Bistro a few times, and each time: experience is an extreme plus, and the food is really good.  Yes, it's pricey because it's small plates -- hey, it's Vegas.

They have an incredible menu, large, and very creative in the categories of: Sushi and Sashimi, Soup, Dim Sum, Tempura, Fish, Noodles and Rice, and numerous dishes "Noble Treasures From The Sea", "From The Sky", and "From The Land".

I've tried a lot!  But, this is the best!
===========================
Miso Glazed Chilean Sea Bass with Wok Vegetables ($39)

I've tried each of these, and hardly near done with the menu:
==============================================
Yellowtail Sashimi with Jalape√±o and Ponzu Sauce ($18), Octopus Salad with Aji Amarillo and Baby Watercress ($19), Crunchy Spicy Yellowtail Roll with Crushed Onion ($15), Shrimp Tempura ($8), Spicy Tuna, Avocado in Soy Paper Roll ($16), Crispy Spicy Tuna Roll with Avocado in Soy Paper ($17), Crispy Soft Shell Crab with Yuzu Mayonnaise ($17), Roasted Shishito Peppers with Yuzu ($10), TAO Temple Salad ($12), Chicken Satay with Peanut Sauce ($14), Crispy Tuna Sashimi Roll with Edamame ($17), Chicken Wing Lollipops ($18), Spicy Tuna Tartare on Crispy Rice ($19), Thai Crab Cakes with Mango Chili Sauce ($19), Spicy Thai Dumpling Soup ($13), Glazed Salmon with Sesame Eggplant and Shiso Vinaigrette ($31), Crispy Coconut Shrimp with Spicy Thai Peanut Sauce ($33), Filet Mignon Cooked in a Ginger Scallion Broth with Wasabi Dipping Sauce ($38), Spicy Hoi Yin Eggplant ($12), Vegetable Fried Brown Rice ($13). 

Their motto:
=========
Our servers are here to guide you, so please call upon them for the smallest of favors. TAO has no set rules. Be creative, live long, be happy and follow your own path. ...And the Emperor said, "let the party begin!"

Conclusion:
=========
Make a reservation late with your sweetheart and go!  Great place.  After, go upstairs to Tao Nightclub.

the food is WAY too salty.  portions were generous and my favorite was the giant fortune cookie- definitely the highlight.  everything else was ehh.. 

The ambiance and decor was nice as well..
I'd say this restaurant is more for booty shakin than dining.

I was lucky enough to have a girls night comp'd dinner here a while back and I really loved the atmosphere, great music, low lighting, great service and all the great looking people (waiters/waitresses). Because we were a comp'd dinner, they brought out a wide selection of sushi, appetizers and entrees. I felt like we almost got to try everything on the menu! 

My recommendations: Shrimp and Lobster Dumplings, Kung Pao Chicken, sushi of your choice- tasted very fresh, and I loved the seaweed sampler. 

It was a great setting for a group, a bit loud if you are looking to be able to talk to everyone all at once, but great for small conversations all around the table. Was a great way to start the night off before heading to the nightclub in Tao.

And they make great dirty martini's here!

I expected a lot from this place. I liked the vibe. The service was fine, not great but fine. I arrived right at opening and had a seat at the bar. I ordered the wagyu beef tartare, octopus salad and sea bass. The food was all good but overall the plating was very boring and amateurish. The tartare was very good except for the fact that being rolled in rice then flour and deep fried it totally covered the taste of the tartare. It was good because it was fried perfectly. The octopus salad was a total miss with overly acidic dressing and almost no octopus. The Chilean sea bass was the best fish I've ever tasted, absolutely delicious except for the fact it looked like it was just thrown over some vegetables. Once you factor in the $170.00 for one person drinking 2 glasses of house wine it becomes much less appealing.

Go no farther than the Seabass!  Miso glazed to perfection!  We are so addicted to this dish we always order it, and let our 2nd dish be whatever...  Crunchy Spicy Yellowtail is one of the best rolls in town, often we come just for a quick nibble of that.  Be sure to make a reservation!

For the past year I have been going to Tao regularly, once or twice a month for the Thursday night girls' dinner.  The food and drinks are excellent! But the last few times we went we had to wait like 30 minutes past our reservation time for a table.  I'm not sure if it's because priority is given to the paying customers, or if it's just turned into one of those places. I don't think I would stay if I had to wait 30+ minutes for a table plus pay a lot of $$ for food.  

Since they give us a variety of appetizers and sushi each time, I have some favorites.  The stuffed shrimp and the chicken skewers are delicious! We get those almost every time. The dumplings are also decent.  And the sushi is always fresh. I never had rubbery fish there. The unagi is also really good. My favorite dessert are the won tons and ice cream.  

Of course Tao is really trendy, loud and always crowded.  The restaurant is huge and most of the people are young and pretty.  Although most of the time you see a huge group of strippers.  We've always had good service even though the restaurant is busy.  And after dinner you can go upstairs to the club and dance it off!

I was pleasantly surprised with this place. 

This restaurant has been open for years but only came for the nightlife after the regular restaurant hours closed.  The nightlife was fun and I saw a slew of gorgeous women.  You will too :)

My friends and I were here for a real estate conference and one of them suggested this place.  Initially, I thought it would be like PF Changs, Americanized Chinese Food, but I ordered the sea bass (their specialty) and it was awesome!  Most of my bias beforehand comes from the fact that I am asian and eat chinese food everyday, so I did not think some fancy chinese american restaurant would really compare, but it was solid.  

Everytime I come to a new venue, I always trust the waitresses and go with their recommendation.  It has served me well.  

Be mindful that you are in the Venetian, so I think when the tab was said and done, my dish, one drink and my share of the appetizers and tip came to about $86

Tao was a great ending to our vacation in Vegas.  When we went, it was luckily not very busy.  We had a party of six and ate at a large round table which I like.  Much easier to conversate with everyone that way.  Our waiter was very helpful and informative.  We had no idea what to get and all of his suggestions were spot on!  At first I was worried that we were not going to have enough food, but since we ate family style, we order a bunch of little plates so we could sample many things.

It was a crowded night when we went for dinner around 8ish. We got seated at the sushi bar and our waiter was with us right away. 

Food: arrived on a timely manner.
Sashimi special that was expensive- salty 9 piece with 3 different kinds of fish. The fishes had way too much salt on them! It did seem like a very good quality though.
Some sort of crab roll?- good
Wasabi crusted filet mignon with tempura onion rings- nice and tender with lotsa flavor.

Price is kind of expensive, but good quality food. We also ordered 1 drink each. After all it is vegas. Save up a lot of money so you can splurge!

I came here for a convention's welcome reception.  Their food is great and their drink is absolutely amazing; however, the service is extremely slow.  I had their burger slider and their vegetable egg roll, which was delicious.  I wish I had more of those.  The drink I ordered was Sex on the beach, which is the best I ever had.  If you're at Vegas, this is one of the night club that you gotta check out (not the restaurant, over priced)

Hey Tiff, how was....

The Food: So good, tasty
The Scene: TRENDY - vibrant, loud, good vibes and energy
The Music: eclectic soundtrack 
The Decor: entrance is lined with bathtub.  Asian influenced decor with a GIANT Buddha in the center
The Drinks: average, not too strong. good selection of cocktails
The Location: 2nd Floor in the Venetian 
The Parking: paid in the casino lots
The Service: superior. Our waitress Jamie was exception! 5-stars!
The Dam$ge: $$$ (average entree $30, drink $15)
The Reason: Mother's Birthday, parents were on vacation (7 people)
The D'Over?" All the time, at least once a year!

#Access

I had the most amazing experience here. I've been to TAO in NYC, but this one seemed better. Our waiter, Anthony, was amazing. It wasn't crowded bc we ate dinner at 5pm which is an ideal time. It probably gets crowded later on. The service was great and the food came very quickly. I got the miso soup as my first course and it was delicious. My mother got the lobster pot stickers I think, and they were great. The TAO martini is great (as told by my mother). I got the fried brown rice which was so good. It was a smaller portion which was great for me. The dessert was soooo good as well. I believe we got the sampler. The food was great and I had a great experience. Yes it's a little pricey, but that's bc it's a duplicate restaurant from the 2 in NYC. The attire can be nice casual. I wore heels and a nice dress and may have overdressed but who cares it's Vegas:)

After a long day on my feet while on a business trip yesterday, I was looking forward to sipping on a delicious cocktail and enjoying great food with co-workers. Instead, what I got was an unexpected surprise...

We arrived on time for our 8:00 p.m. reservation and were seated relatively quickly. The ambiance is very chic and trendy and the noise level actually wasn't as loud as I was expecting. Since there were six of us, we decided to order a variety of items from the menu like the Kung Pao Chicken, Shrimp Tempura Rolls, Crunchy Spicy Yellowtail Roll, Coconut Shrimp, and Spicy Smoked Salmon Roll to name a few.

Once the food began to arrive, we all started indulging in the sushi dishes. As I took my first bite of the Shrimp Tempura Roll (which was delicious by the way), I felt something hot dripping down my back... it was the Coconut Shrimp!!! YES, THE COCONUT SHRIMP! One of the people bringing the food to our table (not our waiter) had accidentally spilled the dish on my brand new WHITE blazer. Now, I understand that accidents happen. What bothers me is that the only apology I heard, was from our waiter (Edmond?) who had NOTHING to do with the incident. Even the manager did not apologize right away. He said he'd be back to check in on me... he did NOT check in on me during the remainder of the meal. 

Once the six of us finished our meal, a complimentary platter filled with an assortment of desserts was delivered to our table (giant fortune cookie, ice cream, molten chocolate cake, chocolate Buddha)... as an apology I'd imagine since the only one I received by that point was from our waiter. Then (hallelujah!), the manager reappeared. He brought me a dry cleaning slip (which was useless considering I was leaving the next morning). He offered to reimburse me for the dry cleaning costs and if for some reason the dry cleaner could not remove the stains, they'd replace my white blazer for me. Then, once we received the bill, I FINALLY heard him apologize for the incident.

We were not comped for even a portion of the meal or offered a discount even though we asked. The waiter actually laughed when we asked which I felt was very unprofessional. We paid and left... never to return again! The food was pretty good but not worth the inconvenience and terribly unprofessional service from the management to the servers. Though Tao Asian Bistro had been recommended to us, we will not be recommending this place nor dining here in the future. I'll stick to Katsuya!

P.S. After dinner we went back to the hotel so I could change before going out. Turns out the Coconut Shrimp seeped through my white blazer and onto my shirt as well. I've posted the photos on my account. Feel free to check it out.

So before coming to this place, just from the outside it looked too fancy for me to eat in, but the pricing on the menu was actually really decent.  This place is very well decorated and the staff is really friendly. We got seated since we made prior reservations. The restaurant was perfectly dimmed. We asked our waitress for recommendations since we have never been there before. Annie, our waitress recommended us 3 appetizers which was the Bao Buns, the buns were really soft and tasty it was filled with meat. The second plate was the spicy tuna with rice crisp, I really enjoyed this dish. The spicy tuna wasn't overly spicy and I really liked the crispy rice. The third plate was the lobster potsticker which was pretty good with its sauce that it's doused in. I really enjoyed all three plates. Annie was a great waitress, she always came to our table to check up on us and refilled our waters. My overall experience was just very pleasant.

Nice atmosphere, live dj and tasty food. The staff are really nice and knowledgeable. The food is enough for a group of people, really fresh. I highly recommend the huge fortune cookie!!! It was the best I have ever had with chocolate and vanilla mouse with fresh fruit and obviously your fortune. Then after you can go up the club. I will go back here to eat again!

This place was the biggest disappointment ever. Definitely on the list of the worst restaurant meals I've had. I ordered the chicken pad thai and gross. It was horrible and tasted dry. If you do order it - share, the portion is HUUUUGEE.

This place gets two stars because the customer service was good.

Awesome meal with great ambiance 
Our party of three decided to share entrees. While the orange chicken we had was average, the sea bass was the best I fm have ever had. Melts I. Your mouth, buttery yet a bit flakey. I was jealous we decided to share this dish. We also had the shrimp pad tai which was very tasty with shorter thin noodles   We also enjoyed the hot and sour soup.  The service was friendly and attentive. 
I look forward to a return trip just for the sea bass!

Good food, good service, good atmosphere. Nice place to come if you're craving Asian fusion or are celebrating something special. I do recommend you come with a fair amount of people so you'll be able to sample a little of everything as it is family style portions. Items that stood out for me on the menu were the sea bass, shitake mushrooms, and udon noodles. Lots of mushroom which I like and you can taste a hint of the sake they used in it. The sea bass was very fresh, tender, a bit fishy though so if you don't like the fish taste, I wouldn't recommend it. And last but not least, the filet mignon was nicely peppered, grilled, and complimented the udon noodles well. All the other stuff we ordered like pad thai, kung pao chicken, or the lobster wonton didn't excite my taste buds. The kung pao chicken had more vegetables then it did chicken. Boo. The pad thai was dry and not enough sauce, also I found it odd to serve a Thai dish at a Chinese fusion restaurant. The lobster wonton were mediocre. Would have been better if they were smaller or maybe fried. They had too much filling and were soggy. The little fortune cookies they give you at the end are kind of fun. They're chocolate cookies with your not so everyday fortunes :) Service was amazingly fast, 3.5 stars for you Tao!

Excellent food --- best I've had in Vegas. And pretty much the only reason I'm going to give Tao 2 stars.

WARNING -- if you are a dude, and plan on having dinner with several dudes (i.e. bachelor party) at Tao, don't count on getting line passes to get into the nightclub.  I went with three friends on Sat, 4/21, and after dropping $400 on dinner, we were informed by the HR manager looking hostess that we couldn't get line passes because we "threw off the guy to girl ratio" at the club. That's about the worst customer service I've ever experienced in my life... way to take care of your customers! We might as well have eaten at some fast food joint and started waiting in line at 8pm with the other sunglasses wearing jackoffs that infest Vegas these days.

Oh... and apparently K-Fed was there the same night having dinner with his posse.

It was my friends birthday so we decided to eat here, the food was very well made, the presentations and time it took to consume it was great, the prices were very steep, and the price did not match the portion. and I guess I can say that it is Vegas, but I just wasn't happy. Service was ok. Nothing too special.

Come here for a date, it's very nice with the ambiance.
But overall 

I was a bit disappointed.

ANNIE is amazing!!! Made my restaurant experience memorable which is what I need and what I tell all the people I know about. Annie, I'm going to request you every time I'm here! Thank you! The food you recommended was amazing!
amazing food, good drinks, great service, beautiful setting
